intro: Oglifa heterantha, commonly known as the slender ogli plant, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, palmate leaves. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or white, with five petals and a prominent central stigma. Oglifa heterantha is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along riverbanks.
